clinical_study.official_title: Untersuchung Des Magen-pH in Intubationsanästhesie Bei Kindern

brief_summary.textblock:
Fasting (according to ASA, ESA or institutional guidelines) is an important strategy to minimize the risk of regurgitation, vomiting and pulmonary aspiration during general anaesthesia; the effect of fasting time for clear fluid on gastric pH in children is goal of this study and can be investigated in children undergoing elective procedures in intubation anaesthesia without inconvenience or additional invasive procedure and hence without additional risk
Hypotheses: Gastric pH is higher in children that drink until 1 hour before anaesthesia induction than in those that drink until 2 hours before anaesthesia induction

primary_outcome.description: gastric pH is measured from gastric contents which is sampled in a syringe via an orogastric tube immediately during anaesthesia after tracheal intubation induction; suctioning of the stomach after intubation is a procedure routinely performed in every intubation child in our institution

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 minutes after arrival of patient in operating theatre
secondary_outcome.description: subjective feeling of hunger/thirst given as rating scale from 1 to 4

gastric aspirate volume is the amount of gastric contents which is sampled in a syringe via an orogastric tube immediately during anaesthesia after tracheal intubation induction; suctioning of the stomach after intubation is a procedure routinely performed in every intubation child in our institution

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV) in recovery unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: recovery period, on the average within 90 minutes after end of anaesthesia
recovery period, on the average within 90 minutes after end of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Rating Scale 1 - 5 by blinded nurse (5: severely agitated/emergency delir with subsequent drug therapy, 4: agitated/emergeny delir; 3: slightly agitated; 2: complaining pain but cooperative; 1: cooperative)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the average within 20 minutes after arrival of patient in operating theatre
secondary_outcome.description: Rating scale 1 - 5 by (blinded) anaesthetist: 1: cooperating - 2: anxious but cooperating - 3: hostile - 4: crying - 5: agitated/fighting

arm_group.description: allowed to drink until 1 hour before scheduled anaesthesia induction
allowed to drink until 2 hour before scheduled anaesthesia induction

intervention.description: drinking of clear fluid in preoperative period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 1 / <= 16 years
- ASA class I or II
- elective surgery requiring general anaesthesia using tracheal intubation
Exclusion Criteria:
- disease or dysfunction of gastrointestinal tract
- chronic diseases or conditions not compatible with ASA class I or II
